message.content:
There are numerous possible causes of neck pain, including:

1. Muscle strain: Overuse or sudden movements can cause the muscles in your neck to become strained or fatigued.

2. Poor posture: Slouching while sitting at a desk, using a smartphone for long periods, sleeping with poor head and neck alignment, all contribute to poor posture that can lead to chronic neck pain.

3. Degenerative disc disease: As we age, the discs between our vertebrae lose hydration and begin to break down, which can cause pain in the cervical spine (neck).

4. Herniated disc: A herniated disc occurs when a vertebral disc’s outer layer tears and its inner gel-like core leaks out – this inflamed tissue irritates nearby nerves leading to severe pain radiating from your neck down through the arm.

5. Sprains and strains from accidents or sports injuries

6. Whiplash: Sudden impact due to an automobile accident or other trauma could result in whiplash injury causing muscle strains as well as damage to vertebrae & nerves.

7. Spinal stenosis is also another potential source of serious discomfort; spinal stenosis transpires when the space within your spinal canal narrows putting pressure on nerve roots exiting spinal cord ends- specific symptoms may include numbness & tingling sensations extending into one shoulder/arm region(s).

8) Arthritis - Osteoarthritis (OA) and Rheumatoid arthritis (RA) often affect joints in areas around our heads such as jaws/shoulders thereby making adjacent soft tissues more susceptible towards inflammation + stiffness after prolonged sedentary activities e.g., computer work/job demands requiring repetitive motion patterns affecting upper extremities mainly wrists/elbows/shoulder blade
